System.description: Oversees system-level architecture and integration across hardware and software components.

System Architecture.description: Designs the overall architecture and structure, ensuring alignment between hardware and software components for optimal system performance.

Requirements Engineering.description: Gathers and defines system requirements from stakeholders, translating business needs into technical specifications.

System Integration.description: Manages the integration of various system components, verifying compatibility and ensuring functional interoperability.

System Validation.description: Tests the system as a whole to confirm that it meets all specifications and performance standards.

Software.description: Responsible for developing embedded software solutions for KOSTAL's products.

Embedded Software Development.description: Focuses on developing the core embedded software that drives KOSTAL products, ensuring functionality and efficiency.

Software Architecture.description: Designs and optimizes software structures and frameworks to support system requirements and hardware compatibility.

Software Testing.description: Conducts testing at different stages to verify software reliability and adherence to specifications.

Firmware Development.description: Develops low-level software that interfaces directly with hardware, enabling communication between system components.

Hardware.description: Handles the physical design and development of electronic and mechanical components.

Circuit Design.description: Creates circuit designs and component layouts, including printed circuit boards (PCBs), ensuring performance and compliance with industry standards.

Power Electronics.description: Develops power conversion and management systems to support device functionality and efficiency.

Hardware Testing.description: Performs rigorous tests on hardware components to ensure durability, performance, and reliability under various conditions.

QA.description: Ensures product quality and regulatory compliance through systematic testing and validation.

Software Unit Testing (SWUT).description: Tests individual software units to verify that each module performs as expected in isolation.

Software Integration Testing (SWIT).description: Tests the integration of multiple software modules to ensure they function together correctly within the system.

Software Quality Assurance (SWQ).description: Oversees the entire software development process to ensure quality standards are met and software is fit for release.

Hardware Quality Assurance (HWQ).description: Monitors hardware development to ensure that all physical components meet quality and performance standards.

Functional Testing.description: Tests product functionality to ensure it meets specified requirements and operates as intended.

Compliance Testing.description: Ensures products meet industry standards and regulatory requirements before release.
